title: INtopBackup
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Tatiana Schlossberg, the granddaughter of JFK, says she has a rare terminal cancer
items.description: In an essay in The New Yorker , Tatiana Schlossberg says she has acute myeloid leukemia. She also criticized her relative, Robert F. Kennedy Jr.

items.title: The U.S. Transportation Department is urging air passengers to be on good behavior
items.description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy wants air travelers to be nice this holiday season. A new DOT campaign asks passengers to help each other and than...

items.title: Texas men indicted in plot to take over Haitian island and enslave women and children
items.description: Gavin Weisenburg, 21, and Tanner Thomas, 20, planned to take over Gonave Island and murder all men on the island, prosecutors alleged.

items.title: Machu Picchu hit by a row over tourist buses
items.description: Protests have taken place over the coaches that take visitors up to the world heritage site in Peru.

items.title: US hails 'tremendous progress' at Ukraine peace talks
items.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio says more work is needed to finalise a US-Ukraine deal that will then need Russia's agreement.

items.title: Chinese land, US radar and ties to Taiwan: The geopolitics rattling a tiny Pacific nation
items.description: Palau's strategic location and diplomatic ties with Taiwan have made it a focus of US-China rivalry.

items.title: U.S. considers dropping leaflets in Venezuela as it ramps up pressure on Maduro
items.description: The U.S. is considering dropping leaflets on Caracas as a kind of psychological warfare to pressure Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, multiple U.S....

items.title: Gaza food kitchens still missing essential products despite ceasefire
items.description: Israel is allowing more food into Gaza, but aid workers say vital ingredients needed to improve people's diets are still missing.

items.title: JFK's granddaughter, Tatiana Schlossberg, says she has terminal cancer diagnosis
items.description: Tatiana Schlossberg, who has been married to doctor George Moran since 2017, has two young children.

items.title: Poll shows Americans pessimistic about economy as holiday shopping gets underway
items.description: Holiday shopping is kicking off, and a new CBS News poll shows only 32% of Americans think the economy is in good shape. Shanelle Kaul reports.

items.title: Etiquette lessons for Gen Z professionals
items.description: Itay Hod takes us to a class where young professionals are learning to master their manners.

items.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (Nov. 23): The Food Issue
items.description: Jane Pauley hosts our annual "Eat, Drink & Be Merry" holiday broadcast exploring all things epicurean! Check out our menu...

items.title: Hunting down those who kill people to sell their body parts for 'magic charms'
items.description: BBC Africa Eye uncovers two so-called "juju" practitioners, who offer to obtain body parts for ritual purposes.

items.title: G20 summit closes in South Africa after U.S. absence
items.description: The G20 closed in Johannesburg without a ceremonial hand over to the U.S., its next chair, after Washington boycotted the summit.

items.title: 50 schoolchildren escape captivity in Nigeria, more than 200 still held
items.description: Fifty of the 303 schoolchildren abducted from a Catholic school in Nigeria's Niger state have escaped and are now with their families.

items.title: Wisconsin woman in 2014 Slender Man stabbing is missing
Gunman who killed a Florida deputy dies from injuries
Aftermath of Chicago’s intense immigration crackdown leaves lawsuits, investigations and anxiety
items.description: Chicago has entered what many consider an uneasy phase of a Trump administration immigration crackdown that has already led to thousands of arrests. W...
